channel.title: Trying to Install Ubuntu on Flash Drive
channel.description: So I'm trying to install Ubuntu 9.10 to an 8GB flash drive and just have a quick question. It all seems pretty straight forward except for a part about a casper-rw file. I have no clue what this is :fffuuu: . It says it's used to save stuff between boot ups and it can be anywhere between 1GB and 4GBs through the script provided or you can make it any size you want using another method. Should I make it the same size as my flash drive?

item.title: Trying to Install Ubuntu on Flash Drive
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Okay, cool. I’m going to do it that way. Thanks .

Read full topic
item.source: Trying to Install Ubuntu on Flash Drive

item.title: Trying to Install Ubuntu on Flash Drive
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Duh. Just make sure it uses all the available space on the flash drive.

item.title: Trying to Install Ubuntu on Flash Drive
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I doubt it, if you want a persistent image, you’ll just have to boot from the CD first.

Or from a non-persistent image on another flash drive.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to Install Ubuntu on Flash Drive
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Well first you burn it to a CD, boot from your CD and then,

Launch the USB Startup Disk creator tool from System->Administration->Create a USB startup disk.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to Install Ubuntu on Flash Drive

item.description:
So I’m trying to install Ubuntu 9.10 to an 8GB flash drive and just have a quick question. It all seems pretty straight forward except for a part about a casper-rw file. I have no clue what this is :fffuuu: . It says it’s used to save stuff between boot ups and it can be anywhere between 1GB and 4GBs through the script provided or you can make it any size you want using another method. Should I make it the same size as my flash drive?
